alert.note: Alert for Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued January 14 at 9:25AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...A Heat Advisory is in effect through 6 pm this evening... * WHAT...Heat Index values from 110 to 115... * WHERE...American Samoa * WHEN...through 6 pm this evening * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hot temperatures and persistently high dewpoint temperatures in the upper 80s are contributing to elevated heat index values. FAUTUAGA MO LE VEVELA O LE EA OFISA O LE TAU PAGO PAGO AS 924 TAEAO ASO SA IANUARI 14 2024 ...UA IAI NEI le FAUTUAGA MO LE VEVELA O LE EA SEIA OO I LE 6 i le afiafi nei... * MAFUAAGA...Vevela lagonaina e mai le 110 seia oo i le 115. * TAIMI...seia oo i le 6 i le afiafi nei * AAFIAGA...E mafai ona aafia tagata ona o le vevela o le ea ma le aasa ua iai nei * FAAOPOOPOGA AUILIILI...Ona o le faitau aofa`i o le vevela o le ea mo nai itula ua mavae atu, ma le agi malie o savili ua lagonaina ai le tumau o le a`asa o le la ma le vevela o le ea i le aso. FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... Ia tele ina inu vai malu, mapu i se potu malulu, agai ese mai le la, ma siaki aiga ma tuaoi. Ia manatua fanau iti ma meaola tausi e aua ne`i tuulafoaia/tuu-valeina i totonu o taavale i so`o se taimi lava. Ia faaeteete pe afai o fai sau galuega pe e te nofonofo i fafo. Pe a mafai, ia toe fuafua galuega mamafa ma le faigata ina ia faatino i le taeao po poo le afiafi. Ia e silafia auga ma faailo o gasegase o le tino pe a aafia se tagata i le vevela. Ia faaaoga ofu mama, malu ma le o o pe a mafai. Ina ia faaitiitia le aafiaga o galuega i fafo, e faamalosia e le Occupational Safety and Health Administration le faia o malologa pupu`u i le paolo ma nofoaga o loo iai se ea malulu. Mo se tagata ua aafia i auga o le vevela e tatau ona faamalolo i se nofoaga paolo ma le malu. O gasegase e mafua mai i le vevela o faalavelave faafuase`i. Valaau le 911.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
